title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
hi i have the situation very similar to the rossman wiki.

Green light, no light: 0.05 A on power supply.

P5VS3_EN_L = 3.42V (pin 2 of Q7221)
P5VS3_ENTRIP = 0V (pin 6 of Q7221)
When Q7221 was removed, PP5V_S3 was good (5V).

PM_SLP_S4_L = 0 V (pin 1 of Q7911)

in my case the consumption is much lower and the PCH does not heat.

any ideas?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
We need more specific information.
3V3_S5/SUS both present?
Exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (without battery)?
Check PCH's RTC signals.

Any history fault available?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
I don't have any history of why the computer stopped working.

3V3_S5 = 3.3V
3v3_sus is not present (0V)
Exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (without battery) = 12.56V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
"Check PCH's RTC signals."
???

Post PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC = 0.6V
RTC_RESET_L = 3.3V
PCH_SRTCRST_L=3.3V
PCH_INTRUDER_L=2.11V
PCH_INTVMEN_L=2.70V


PM_BATLOW_L = 0V
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 0V
PCH_DSWVRMEN =1.95V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
Last 3 signals, all bad.
If 3V3/5V_S5 present, PM_DSW_PWRGD must be present too.
Check S5_PWRGD first.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
I soldered U7941 again and now I have the 3 signals


PM_BATLOW_L = 3.2V
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.44V
PCH_DSWVRMEN = 2.5V

and also S5_PWRGD = 3.05V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
PCH_INTRUDER_L is a bit too low; just too close at lower limit (2.1V).
Force it soldering 330K instead of 1M, at R1801.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: Measuring PCH_INTRUDER_L I see that it is a bit unstable. starts at 1.70V and goes up until it reaches 2.10V, 2.12V approximately

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: R1801 is good (1M)

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
"Force it soldering 330K instead of 1M, at R1801."
Did that???

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: not yet, before doing it I wanted to know if it was important that PCH_INTRUDER_L was unstable

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
Very important.
Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH, or PCH sinks too much current on that line.
Force the signal, as above explained.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: Make sure you don't touch the probes when measuring and you use a decent multimeter (10MΩ input impedance), since INTRUDER# has a very weak pull-up of 1MΩ is it pulled down very easily.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: OK, I ALREADY REPLACED R1801. NOW PCH_INTRUDER_L = 2.7V. how much should PCH_INTRUDER_L measure?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
2.7V is perfect.
Board still doesn't turn on?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: no, it still doesn't turn on. When connecting the power supply it has a peak of 0.20V for about half a second and then drops to 0.04V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
Use original 60/85W Magsafe 1 charger.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: measuring PM_PWRBTN_L is very unstable (goes crazy) it changes to many values.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: the fan turns on and off

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
"the power supply it has a peak of 0.20V for about half a second and then drops to 0.04V"
Where, which power rail?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: Im so sorry, I feel so dumb . Its in Amps not Voltage from what the PSU  consumes.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: 0.20A and 0.04A .the fan turns on and off

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: When the fan spins, check which coils get voltage (at same time).

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
on the L7260, L7330, L7550, L7510, L7520, L9701, L3895, L7760 coils.
and what I can see in the multimeter are the following values (for approximately 0.5 seconds)

L7260 = 3.5V
L7330 = 1.3V
L7550 = 0.03V
L7510 = 0.09V
L7520 = 0.09V
L9701 = 0.1V
L3895 =1.4V
L7760 = 1.2V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
Check for pulse at L7630 and L7770.
Also check L7510/20.
Be sure R7402/03 are both good.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
R7402 / 03 are both good.
on L7630 and L7770 they have 0.9V and 1.25V. for that half second.

"Check the pulse on L7630 and L7770" you mean with oscilloscope?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
O-scope not really needed, if you can catch a pulse close to nominal value with DC multimeter.

PM_PWRBTN_L still fluctuates?
PM_RSMRST_L and SMC_ONOFF_L steady high?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L is now stable at 3.44V

PM_RSMRST_L and SMC_ONOFF_L are constantly high.
PM_RSMRST_L = 2.66V
SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.44V

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: PM_PWRBTN_L drops to 0V when you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: yes, PM_PWRBTN_L drops to 0.34V when I activate SMC_ONOFF_L with the button

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message: Then check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4/3_L, at same time.

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
will duty cycle do?

or in what value do I need to do it? %, frequency (Hz) or time (seconds)?

title: doesn't turn on a1278 3115b
message:
DC voltmeter should be good enough.
Just see if these signals try to appear at least.
